decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategies combined with powerful burn spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. Using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to apply early pressure, backed up by Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for reach and removal. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to slow down opponents, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide additional value. Overall, this deck aims to win the game quickly through efficient creature attacks and burn spells.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Murktide Regent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while staying ahead in card advantage with cards like Thought Scour and Consider. Utilizing cards like Unearth and Graveyard Trespasser to recur valuable creatures and spells, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure victory by outvaluing them in the late game. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and threats, the deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents.

The deck focuses on using cards like Underworld Breach and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly recur and cast powerful spells from the graveyard. By utilizing cards that can mill both players like Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to set up a combo finish with Thassa's Oracle or Song of Creation. The deck also includes artifact mana acceleration like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to quickly ramp out its combo pieces. Additionally, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card selection and filtering to help assemble the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to use ramp spells and mana-producing artifacts to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game with their abilities. The deck also includes removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opposing threats. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility by fetching artifacts from the sideboard. The Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and World Breaker disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while Emrakul, the Promised End can close out the game with its powerful abilities. The deck aims to overpower the opponent with its big threats and control elements.

The deck focuses on assembling a specific combo involving cards like Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate massive amounts of value and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Karn, the Great Creator to find key pieces of the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base supports the combo with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga, while also providing flexibility with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly establishing the combo and outpacing the opponent with powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures to control the game while ramping up mana quickly. The key strategy is to play control with cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent, while also ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide additional utility and synergy with the deck's artifact cards. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures while controlling the battlefield.

This Mardu Aggro deck revolves around aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly take control of the game. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent early and often. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and the versatile Ajani, Nacatl Pariah give the deck additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast clock to close out games.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through spells like Ruby Medallion and Desperate Ritual, in order to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells. It also utilizes cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to dig through the deck for combo pieces. The deck aims to win quickly with a large storm count, casting multiple spells in a turn to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Artist's Talent and Wish to further enhance the deck's combo potential and flexibility.

The deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures that can disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Chalice of the Void to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to establish board dominance with big creatures like Emrakul, the World Anew and Sire of Seven Deaths to ultimately overwhelm and out-value the opponent. It also includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer for hand disruption and All Is Dust for board wiping capabilities.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. Control elements are included with cards like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Devourer of Destiny to control the board and maintain board presence. Overall, the strategy is to ramp up quickly to play big threats and control the game while overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard, using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. It also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Force of Negation to control the board while assembling the combo. Additionally, the deck incorporates cards like Ephemerate and Solitude to protect key combo pieces. The main win condition revolves around getting Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Ulamog, the Defiler onto the battlefield with haste and overwhelming the opponent with their powerful abilities.
